ygData.subject: Re: Digest Number 59
ygData.msgSnippet: Not if you count the immense amount of time and money the smith spent getting to the point where he could make banded.  I sell tunics for 20pp from time to
ygData.messageBody:
Not if you count the immense amount of time and money the smith spent
getting to the point where he could make banded. I sell tunics for 20pp
from time to time (mostly because I am too busy to sell, not for lack of
customers) and I still have not recouped my initial investment. My
smithing is only at 115, but at 20pp each for legs and tunic, if I sell the
set (for 40pp), is a break even price. Legs are almost impossible to make.
They fail about 80% of the time.

Message: 13
Date: Wed, 14 Jul 1999 13:11:21 -0500
From: "Jason Coan" <COANJ@...>
Subject: Re: Banded Prices

concidering you have about a 15pp profit if selling at 20pp, 15pp profit is
a bit steep.

>>> "Chris Lin" <chrislin@...> 7.14.99 12:35:09 PM >>>
From: "Chris Lin" <chrislin@...>

Anything above 20 plat is a ripoff? I wouldn't say it's a ripoff, but given
the current market status, it is high. The only ripoff would be if we were
selling much higher than chain prices, which we never will. 20pp for a
tunic is prefectly resonable.

Trenfen of Fennin Ro
